a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: Prevalence of underweight children vs. extreme poverty, 2018
Prevalence of underweight children is the share of children younger than 5 whose weight for age is more than two
standard deviations below the median for the international reference population. Extreme poverty is defined as living
Share of children who are underweight
Source: UNICEF, World Health Organization and World Bank PIP
Note: Poverty data relates to household income or expenditure, measured in international-$ at 2011 prices to account for inflation and differences
in the cost of living between countries.
